message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IT, cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.MM

This paper is likely to belong to the category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it proposes a new optimization approach for Nonnegative Matrix Factorization (NMF), which is a popular technique in machine learning for dimensionality reduction and feature extraction. The paper also discusses the effectiveness of the proposed approach on synthetic, document, and audio datasets, which are common in machine learning research.

The paper also involves the use of Lagrange duality, which is a mathematical optimization technique commonly used in information theory (cs.IT) and signal processing (cs.SI). Therefore, these two categories are also likely to be relevant.

Moreover, the paper discusses the robustness of the proposed approach to unknown noise models, which is a topic of interest in statistical learning (cs.SD). Finally, the paper applies the proposed approach to audio datasets, which is a common application area in multimedia (cs.MM).
